overview:
Gary has had a diverse career in the entertainment and media industry. In 1980 he co-founded Effanel Music, America’s premier mobile recording company and he later brokered the sale of Effanel Music to XM Radio in 2004.

Building on relationships developed through Effanel, Geller branched out and began producing nationally syndicated live radio concerts for NBC “The Source” including such artists as: Santana, Cyndi Lauper, The Judds, etc.

He also worked with artist management companies managing high-profile international tours for such artists as the Rolling Stones, Living Colour, Van Halen, the Sex Pistols, George Benson, David Sanborn, and Al Jarreau, among others.

In 1992 Geller joined burgeoning Muze Inc. As one of Muze’s first employees, Geller facilitated an increase in the company’s revenue base from the low-six figures to 10’s of Millions in revenue. He was responsible for securing, developing and managing Muze’s major accounts including Amazon.com, Apple, Barnes & Noble, Tower Records, Best Buy, Trans World Entertainment, Yahoo, Wal-Mart, Netflix and many others. As a Senior Vice President, Geller was instrumental in the development and expansion of the company from a simple data provider to a technology and service partner.

Geller is married with four children and resides on the Connecticut shoreline. He enjoys bicycling, hiking. kayaking & swimming.
